alert.note: Alert for Northern Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 5:02AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Heavy showers will impact portions of north central Erie County through 600 AM EDT... At 500 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of heavy showers with torrential rainfall over Buffalo, moving slowly east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding in areas of poor drainage and significant ponding on area roadways. Locations impacted include... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, Kenmore, Depew, Amherst, Tonawanda, Lancaster, Williamsville, Erie Basin Marina and East Amherst. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 53 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these showers and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways, particularly flooded underpasses.
